title: Nudges and defaults (intro)
text: A nudge is a small feature of choice architecture that alters people's behavior in a predictable way without forbidding options or significantly changing economic incentives. Setting defaults is a common nudge. For example, automatically enrolling employees in a retirement plan while allowing opt-out tends to increase participation.

Setting defaults is a common nudge.

notes: Used for auditing claims about nudges, choice architecture, defaults, and opt-out enrollment.

title: Paris Agreement basics
text: The Paris Agreement is a climate treaty adopted in 2015. Its central aim is to hold the increase in global average temperature to well below 2°C above pre-industrial levels and to pursue efforts to limit the temperature increase to 1.5°C. Each party submits and updates a nationally determined contribution (NDC) describing its planned actions.

Each party submits and updates a nationally determined contribution (NDC) describing its planned actions.

notes: Used for auditing claims about adoption year and temperature goals of the Paris Agreement and NDCs.

title: Water boiling point and pressure
text: At standard atmospheric pressure (1 atm), pure water boils at 100°C (212°F). Boiling occurs when the vapor pressure of the liquid equals the surrounding pressure. At higher altitudes, atmospheric pressure is lower, so water boils at a temperature below 100°C.

notes: Used for auditing simple physical claims about boiling point and pressure dependence.

title: IP addressing basics
text: IPv4 uses 32-bit addresses. A 32-bit address space contains 2^32 unique addresses, which equals 4,294,967,296. IPv6 uses 128-bit addresses, providing a vastly larger address space than IPv4.

evidence_spans.quote: A 32-bit address space contains 2^32 unique addresses, which equals 4,294,967,296.

notes: Used for auditing numeric and comparative claims about IPv4/IPv6.

title: Amazon rainforest overview
text: The Amazon rainforest is the largest tropical rainforest on Earth. Much of it lies in Brazil, and it also extends into other South American countries. The Amazon Basin contains a vast network of rivers, including the Amazon River. Deforestation in the Amazon can reduce biodiversity and affect regional rainfall patterns.

Deforestation in the Amazon can reduce biodiversity and affect regional rainfall patterns.

notes: Used for auditing claims about geography, size characterization, and deforestation impacts.

title: Solar vs lunar eclipses
text: A solar eclipse occurs when the Moon passes between Earth and the Sun and blocks all or part of the Sun's light. A total solar eclipse happens when the Moon completely covers the Sun as seen from a particular location on Earth. A lunar eclipse occurs when Earth passes between the Sun and the Moon, and Earth's shadow falls on the Moon.
